summary: The documents provided do not contain any information about an individual named Jerry Ray. All documents pertain to communications between the FBI, its field offices, and the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) regarding investigations into the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and John F. Kennedy. The documents detail requests for files, informant information, and agent photographs, as well as investigations into individuals and groups like the National States Rights Party and COINTELPRO operations. Without additional context, it is impossible to determine Jerry Ray's role or significance in the JFK assassination context based on these documents alone.
significance: Insufficient information to determine significance in the JFK context.
